description: The Nearest Neighbor Database (NNDB) is a web-based resource for disseminating parameter sets for predicting nucleic acid secondary structure stabilities. For each set of parameters, the database includes the set of rules with descriptive text, sequence-dependent parameters in plain text and html, literature references to experiments and usage tutorials. Also covered are parameters for predicting RNA folding free energy and enthalpy changes.
name: NNDB

metadata.abstract: The Nearest Neighbor Database (NNDB, http://rna.urmc.rochester.edu/NNDB) is a web-based resource for disseminating parameter sets for predicting nucleic acid secondary structure stabilities. For each set of parameters, the database includes the set of rules with descriptive text, sequence-dependent parameters in plain text and html, literature references to experiments and usage tutorials. The initial release covers parameters for predicting RNA folding free energy and enthalpy changes. © The Author(s) 2009. Published by Oxford University Press.
metadata.title: NNDB: The nearest neighbor parameter database for predicting stability of nucleic acid secondary structure
